attributes.additional_details: Because it is parliament that is taking 80 pound a month out of my universal credit and not classing it as a change of circumstances. Why?
attributes.background: Give us the terms and conditions for the 20 pound universal credit uplift as a contract.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about Universal Credit, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

If you want the £20 a week uplift to Universal Credit to be made permanent, you might like to sign the following petition:

Make the £20 per week uplift to Universal Credit permanent: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593104

If you want something different to happen you could start a new petition clearly stating what you want to happen.
